website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for casual home tortilla makers who don't need a professional cast iron press. The finished tortillas may not be as large as burrito versions, but they are consistently thin enough for chips or shells.
pros: Lightweight compared to cast iron models
Can be used to make pita bread and mini-pizzas
cons: 6-inch tortillas may be too small for some users
Requires considerable pressure for best results

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Expected!
customer_reviews.text: This tortilla press creates perfect, 6 inch tortillas. It's very well built, and I haven't had any issues with it falling part. I would recommend when using it to place your dough ball towards the top, not the center, as it pushes the tortilla out of the bounds of the plate when you close the press towards the lever, creating a bit of a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Gluten-free tortillas!
customer_reviews.text: I make grain-free tortillas with cassava flour. This press works great! For perfect thickness, do not press hard on the handle, light pressure works best. Light-weight and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Im not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Its very light weight. I was expecting it to be heavier. I only used this twice because it wasn't pressing the tortillas out thin enough. Maybe i was doing something wrong but I still ended up having to roll the tortilla out after pressing it with this. And i felt like i was going to break it which i didn't want to do so i didn't press very hard. Im not a fan...i dont really like this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for making pita bread and mini pizzas!
customer_reviews.text: This press is great for making flat bread! I use it all of the time to make pita bread. I portion the dough into balls and flatten them in this press. It's much faster than rolling them out by hand. This also works for mini pizzas. I use Glad Press'n Seal to cover the top and bottom of the press; then I spray both the top and bottom with non-stick spray before I press the dough. Cleanup is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Make a tortilla bowl like a restaurant!!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love other these pans!! I love Taco Salad....now I can make it at home like a pro! My tip is to spray the pan then after you place the tortilla in, spray again, and pierce in a few places to prevent puffing. I cannot believe the result!!! It’s like restaurant quality at home!!
customer_reviews.author: Weez

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made but a little on the small side
customer_reviews.text: I had never made tortillas before and it was actually much easier than i thought it would be. This press makes it easy to press out the tortillas. I gave it four stars instead of 5 for 2 reasons: The tortillas are a little on the small side and the dough pushes to the handle side of the press every time making them uneven. I had to put the dough almost all the way at the back in order to get evenly formed tortillas. Overall, it is very well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the pin holding the handle slips out and it's a little annoying to get back in
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough. Sometimes the pin holding the handle slips out and it's a little annoying to get back in, but well made otherwise. I do wish it would squish the tortillas a bit flatter, but they're still delicious and getting shoved into my head hole, so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: ArielZ

customer_reviews.title: Superior Tortilla Shell pans!
customer_reviews.text: I made two tortilla shells with these and filled them up with seasoned chicken, lettuce, olives, tomatoes and salsa and it was delicious! Preheat oven to 350F, spray the interior of the shells with oil (I used coconut oil), and I sprayed the shells again on the inside before popping them into the oven for 10-12 minutes. The tortilla shells came out looking golden and yummy, and my family loved the novelty of having these taco salads at home. Stainless steel, easy to clean and store. I highly recommend these pans.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi256

customer_reviews.title: Strange. Reviews here do not match item.
customer_reviews.text: This product are taco tongs not a taco press. All the reviews here discuss the press and not the tongs. The tong doesn't work. If the owner wants to do a demo video here, that could cancel out my review. I tried everything. The owner can email me at officialcharlieemail@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sharar

customer_reviews.title: EZ Meal - EZ Clean.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to put Taco Salads into the family "evening meal" rotation, these small pans are a must have. Shapes the tortilla perfectly, and clean up is easy (peasy).
customer_reviews.author: Wyzen Hymer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this press so far! It makes amazing tortillas! 5/22/18 - Still in love with this device! It has performed exactly as i wanted, and is a quality item (i was honestly expecting less). Totally recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Komski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: These are very useful to make tortilla bowl out of flat tortillas. Only takes about 10 minutes in the oven. These pas are very easy to hand wash and do not sitck.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Very important
customer_reviews.text: Worse product . After just 2 washes this is what happened to it. It started having some black and white deposits and cudnt use it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Susida Thirumal

customer_reviews.title: Better off using regular tongs
customer_reviews.text: This make and extremely wide taco shell and it's not even very good at that.
customer_reviews.author: XcvX

customer_reviews.title: Tortilla shapers
customer_reviews.text: Don't need to have salad in boring bowls with these around. And ice cream bowls are fun, too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Just Like Restaurant Bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I really love taco salads, but there is no easy way to make the flour tortilla bowls. To fry them would create a crazy mess. These work very well and come out crispy and light just like the ones at the restaurant. I spray the actual tortillas with a little olive oil to give them a more browned crunchy texture as they cook. These are super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: TxGal4Ever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for old school fresh taco salads!!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I looked on Amazon !! We use buy the shell kits that were in the cold section at the store but they quit carrying them. This is even better !! Can make them at home.. just spray with cooking oil and press in the tortilla.. bake and fill when they are oven hot :)
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Thomason

customer_reviews.title: I purchased as a gift for my father since i have a sturdy one that i use regularly
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot more flimsy and cheap feeling than i expected. I purchased as a gift for my father since i have a sturdy one that i use regularly, this was very light, which someone might prefer, but to mean it felt very cheap. that being said it works and still makes great tortillas.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: Tortillas are too thick
customer_reviews.text: I had read about it not pressing the tortillas thin enough, but the ones I read were talking about corn tortillas, which should be suoer thin. I like my flour tortillas a little thicker, so I thought this would be ok. The end with the lever gets pretty thin, but the hinge side does not. I had to still use a rolling pin and even then they were more like a flat bread than a tortilla.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tortilla presser
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all, usually you place the “masa” and it should go fast, this one is hard to press and when you do it slips to the side causing the tortilla to be extra small and dented on one side. Don’t recommend this at all. Plus the maker is small
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this product. Because I must eat most meals at home this press comes in handy!

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: These are just the size I was looking for and I would be 100% happy with them if the edges weren't a little on the sharp side. I cut my finger when taking it out of the package. However, now that I am aware of this, it is no big deal.

customer_reviews.title: they work great

The dough would need to be fairly lightweight in that case. Small size makes for perfect corn tortillas and stores easily without taking up room.

customer_reviews.text: Does not make tortillas thin enough, poorly designed. Had to use a rolling pin since tortillas where very thick after using. Would not recommend buying.

It has smooth plates, and a nice sturdy design, and I even dropped it once by accident, from about 3.5 feet from my kitchen counter to the ground, and it sustained no damage and works great. I would buy this item again in the future, if I ever needed another one for some reason.

customer_reviews.title: ... too small and light-weight to give the user a good tortilla. A professional chef advised me that the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am going to have to work around the limitations of this press -- it is too small and light-weight to give the user a good tortilla. A professional chef advised me that the best type of plastic to place on the plates is not a baggie, but rather a cut out from a plastic or coated shopping bag (not a grocery store bag but the type you might get for a purchase at a more upscale department store). She also advised to wipe the bag off thoroughly between making the tortillas. I wasted three cups of masa and 45 minutes trying to get a tortilla that didn't look like it was for a Barbie doll.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Winston

customer_reviews.title: No non-stick coating and dough routinely gets into the hinge making cleaning a headache
customer_reviews.text: The tortillas this thing makes are small and SUPER thin. It also does not have a non-stick coating at all so be prepared to either use cooking spray or dry flour to keep your shells from sticking to this thing. Also, when making the shells, the excess dough often gets into the hinge and is a headache to clean out. Finally, this thing feels like cheap plastic in that I feel like I am about to break it just by pressing out shells.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Delicious Homemade Tortillas
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tortilla press for about three weeks and have used it five times. It is simple to use, and lightweight, yet has just enough heft to keep it from feeling flimsy. If you line both sides of the press with plastic (cut a freezer Ziploc bag into two pieces, each a bit bigger than the press plates), the tortillas peel off easily and intact, and clean up is an absolute breeze. There is a huge difference between homemade and store-bought tortillas; I don't think I could ever go back to that same old bag of Mission tortillas.

I don’t know why anyone would spend more for a tortilla press, and being cast aluminum, it won’t rust. Six inches is more than large enough for a taco, by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee_ATL

product_meta.title: HIC Harold Import Co. 43172 Tortilla Press for 6-Inch Tortillas, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:Tortilla PressHIC’s Tortilla Press is specially designed for creating 6-inch homemade tortillas and other artisan flat breads of the perfect thickness every time. Dough pressed into a consistent thickness looks great and cooks evenly. No more hand rolling or tortillas with doughy, undercooked areas. With its sturdy handle, HIC’s Tortilla Press allows effortless leverage to press perfectly consistent dough every time. Easily press the perfect tortillas for creating wraps, tostadas, quesadillas, tortilla chips, and more. Perfect for making all types of tortillas, including flour tortillas, whole grain, corn, low carb, and gluten free tortilla wraps. Great for other artisan flat breads, like pita bread, Caribbean roti, focaccia, and moo shoo pancakes, even mini pie crusts, pastry shells, and more. A great addition to cooking accessories for easier food preparation, plus it’s safe and fun when cooking with kids. Easy to use. Prepare the dough recipe or use ready-made dough. For best results, line both sides of the press with plastic wrap, wax paper, or parchment paper to prevent dough from sticking to the press. Roll a small amount of dough into a ball and place it in the center of the press. Flatten the dough slightly by hand then close the press. Fold the handle over the press and apply a firm pressure to create griddle-ready rounds. Gently remove the plastic wrap from the flattened dough and cook according to recipe. Made from heavyweight aluminum, HIC’s Tortilla Press is durable, sturdy, and easy to use. Instructions included. Hand wash in warm, soapy water and dry thoroughly before storing.
feature_bullets: HIC’s Tortilla Press for creating homemade tortillas and artisan flat breads with a consistent thickness that look great and cook evenly
Made from heavyweight aluminum for durability; sturdy handle for effortless leverage; makes 6-inch tortillas; Product measures 8.5-inches with handle
Press dough to the perfect thickness every time; great for pita bread, Caribbean roti, focaccia, moo shoo pancakes, mini pie or tart shells, and more
Line press with plastic wrap, add dough, flatten slightly by hand, close press, apply pressure with handle to flatten dough into griddle-ready rounds
